Detailed Description

Representation of daemon's / module's configuration parsed from a file. In a normal case, the ModuleManager allocates and de-allocates a Configuration instance for all modules, hence only the get-functions should be of interest to module writers.

Value paths are of the format `section:subsection:value'. An additional colon may be prepended to the whole path. The the config file format for a detailed describtion of sections and values.

const char *  defaultValue 
) [virtual]

Obtain a configuration value as a string.

Parameters:
[in] valuePath Value's path in the file.
[in] defaultValue Value returned if the path was not found.
Returns:
A string pointer to the value, valid until the Configuration object is destroyed or a new file is parsed.

list< string > libnetworkd::Configuration::getStringList ( const char *  listPath  )  [virtual]

Obtain a configuration value list as string list.

Parameters:
[in] valuePath Value's path in the file.
Returns:
A list of string pointers representing the values of the list. If the value cannot be found, an empty list is returned.

list< string > libnetworkd::Configuration::enumerateSubkeys ( const char *  keyPath  )  [virtual]

List all subkeys (subsections or values) for a given section path. A single colon or an empty string indicate the root section.

Parameters:
[in] keyPath Path to enumerate the children for.
Returns:
A list to string pointers containing the childrens' names, valid until the Configuration object is destroyed or a new file is parsed.

Check presence of any subkeys (sections or values).

Parameters:
[in] keyPath Path of section or value to check.
Returns:
Boolean indicating presence of subkeys.

Get type of node specified by the given path.

Parameters:
